create.description: set to false if you want to pass in an existing secret
create.title: create

enabled.description: Disable UI via canary-checker by default.
enabled.title: enabled

imageName.description: supabase/postgrest if registry is ecr and postgrest/postgrest if registry is docker.io
imageName.title: imageName

identityRoleMapper.description:
Specify the cel-go script or the file path to the cel script.
Script is used to map the user identity to the role & teams.

configMap.description: specify the script via a config map that'll be mounted to `mountPath`
configMap.title: configMap

identityRoleMapper.title: identityRoleMapper

ingress.description: Enable ingress only if the UI is deployed outside of the cluster and calls public incident-commander api endpoint.
ingress.title: ingress

kratos.description:
- if chart name (incident-commander) is changed, change the urls. E.g.
oryKratosURI url points to the incident-commander service with a suffix.

- deletion of configmap and using our own secrets file etc. `make chart` will
extract kratos and delete configmap-config.yaml, so that we can explicitly -
set config manually. Allows for us to use templates for config and include -
identity-schema json file (encoding it as part of templating process).

- Disable kratos secret. Again, we explicitly generate secrets.yaml to include
database URL in it.

configmap.description:
NOTE(ciju): we have our own template for kratos-config. Which means kratos
templates doesn't have access to the config file, to generate hash from.
This could be fixed by explicitly passing hash value?
configmap.title: configmap

fullnameOverride.description: don't include Release.name in kratos name
fullnameOverride.title: fullnameOverride

type.description:
Could be either job or initContainer. initContainer used here because
job runs as a pre-install,pre-update hook, but requires values from
secret, which are not yet install when the charts are being installed
for the first time.
type.title: type

config.description: Config to be merged in kratos ConfigMap. See: templates/kratos-config.yaml
config.title: config

enabled.description: Disable kratos secret generation. We explicitly generate kratos secret to have access to database URL for dns key in secret. See: /chart/templates/secrets.yaml
enabled.title: enabled

kratos.title: kratos

nameOverride.description: Use this only if you want to replace the default that is .Chart.Name as the name of all the objects.
nameOverride.title: nameOverride

collector.description: OpenTelemetry gRPC collector endpoint in host:port format
collector.title: collector

properties.description: Properties to configure mission-control feature sets
properties.title: properties

name.description: Annotations to add to the service account
name.title: name

clusterRole.description: Whether to create cluster-wide or namespaced roles
clusterRole.title: clusterRole

exec.description: Allows mission control to exec into pods
exec.title: exec

impersonate.description:
Impersonate allows the service account to impersonate as
- mission-control-reader-role
- mission-control-writer-role
This is used by kubeproxy.
impersonate.title: impersonate

readAll.description: for use with kubernetes resource lookups
readAll.title: readAll

upstream_push.description:
Configuration for pushing data to upstream
upstream_push:
  name: ''
  host: ''
  user: ''
  password: ''
  labels: 'key1=val1,key2=val2'
upstream_push.title: upstream_push
